thread.title: Census Bureau to Release 2020 Census Operational Plan
thread.title_full: Census Bureau to Release 2020 Census Operational Plan - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Census Bureau to Release 2020 Census Operational Plan
text:
U.S. Census Bureau
WASHINGTON , Oct. 1, 2015 /PRNewswire-USNewswire/ -- The following media advisory was released today by the U.S. Census Bureau:
What: U.S. Census Bureau officials will release and discuss the operational plan for conducting the 2020 Census during a live stream of the fall quarterly program management review for the public, key stakeholders and oversight bodies. Additionally, the Census Bureau will provide updates on other census topics, including 2015 National Content Test and 2016 Census Test activities.
The 2020 Census operational plan outlines key operations, the decisions made based on research and testing to date and a timeline for remaining decisions. The innovations planned for the 2020 Census will make it easier for people to respond and save taxpayers more than $5 billion over what it would cost using older methods.
The Census Bureau is releasing this plan five years prior to the 2020 Census - three years earlier than released for the last census. Through the smart use of technology and existing data sources, the 2020 Census can provide substantial taxpayer savings while maintaining a commitment to quality, accuracy and confidentiality.
Presenters will take questions from on-site audience members following completion of their remarks.
When: Tuesday, Oct. 6 , 1 to 4:30 p.m. EDT (detailed agenda to follow)
Where:
U.S. Census Bureau Headquarters
4600 Silver Hill Road, Census Auditorium
Suitland, MD 20746
Who:
Lisa Blumerman , associate director, Decennial Census Programs
Deirdre Bishop , chief, Decennial Management Division
Live Broadcast: Watch the event on " Census Live ."
If closed captioning is required: http://livewrite-ncc.appspot.com/attend?event=cb002
RSVP: If you plan to join us in person, please RSVP by Oct. 2 to pio@census.gov . Seating is limited.
Interviews: Contact the Census Bureau's Public Information Office at pio@census.gov or 301-763-3030 to request an interview.
Public Information Office
301-763-3030 / pio@census.gov
census.gov
Connect with us on Social media
